definitions.definition: a large group of animals of the same type that live and feed together:
a large group of people that is considered together as a group and not separately:
examples: Poor Janine - she just follows the herd (= does what all the other people are doing).

definitions.definition: to make animals move together as a group:
examples: An old woman was herding the goats.

definitions.definition: to make people move somewhere as a group, often against their wishes or with difficulty
